summary: This bill, the Expanding Appalachia's Broadband Access Act, mandates the Comptroller General of the United States to study the Appalachian Regional Commission's ability to integrate low-orbit satellites into broadband projects. The study will assess the capacity of these satellites for business use, evaluate economic growth in areas utilizing them, and analyze the cost-effectiveness of implementing satellite broadband for economic development. The Comptroller General must submit the study's findings to Congress within 90 days of the bill's enactment.
